awd_titl_txt: The VLSI Design of a Parallel Prolog Machine
awd_abstract_narration: This research focuses on the high-level design of a high-speed                  Prolog computer architecture.  This Prolog machine makes use of                 potential unification, AND, and OR parallelism in executing a                   Prolog program.  It also employs hardware parallel units such as                associative memory, multiport registers and stacks, and pipeline                organization to enhance execution speed.  The significance of                   this machine is in its very high-logic inference speed and its                  uniqueness in employing large-capacity associative memory as the                data base.  This hierarchical design is employing a software                    level and RTL-level design using simulation at each level.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
